group_1.textCenter: We almost had him hooked, but at the end of the@day, everyone looks out for their own skin first...
(From experience, it's evident that when this@happens, you don’t make any headway...)

group_1.textRight: Ah, well... I suppose everyone makes mistakes@at times, even you.

group_1.textLeft: But building relationships with people has always@been my strong suit...

group_1.textRight: I was surprised by that, actually.

group_1.textLeft: By my failure, you mean?

group_1.textRight: Ah, no. I remember asking before, but I didn't@realize you were still researching Magical Girls.

group_1.textLeft: It's become a lifelong pursuit for me now.

group_1.textRight: Because your daughter's life is at stake?

group_1.textLeft: That's right. Can you believe it now?

group_1.textRight: Compared to before, I'm starting to feel more@inclined to believe it.
I've started to hear some students talking about it,
and it seems like it might be a topic that hasn't@been thoroughly explored.

group_1.textLeft: I have to thank the rumors then, if they helped@you believe me.
If you don't mind, could you help us spread the@word about Magical Girls?
Or to be more precise, I should say "clear up the@misunderstanding".

group_1.textRight: Professor, you're one lucky man.

group_1.textLeft: Huh...?

group_1.textRight: Have you heard of a local show called@"Nightlife Homeroom"?

group_1.textLeft: Naturally.
A girl named Urara Yume was talking about@Magical Girls on it, right?

group_1.textRight: That's right.
Actually, I’ve been invited to participate in a@segment on the show.
Would you like to join me, Professor Satomi?
It’s a segment dedicated to the peculiar tales@of Yukuni City.
I was originally planning to discuss the Yukuni@Fisherman's Boat Song, but...

group_1.textLeft: That's where the Magical Girl business comes in.

group_1.textRight: Precisely.

group_1.textLeft: What's up?

group_1.textRight: The associate professor who’s supposed to appear@at our next Nightlife Homeroom just called.
She wanted to switch up the topic for her segment.

group_1.textLeft: That's no biggie!@We're just along for the ride, anyway.

group_1.textRight: I can handle it, too, as long as there's some@kind of script.
But what kind of talk topic are we changing to?
Don't be surprised when you hear it, okay?

group_1.textLeft: What's the big deal...

group_1.textRight: "Magical Girls."

group_1.textLeft: [chara:800100:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]Huh?!

group_1.textRight: Ah ha ha!@You're so surprised, you can't even speak?

group_1.textLeft: Oh, come on! You've got to be kidding!@Are we cursed or what?
I'm so sick of getting into trouble already!
No way! Seriously?
I never expected the Magical Girl topic to come@up like this!
Why does she want to talk about Magical Girls@all of a sudden?

group_1.textRight: She wants to straighten out the false rumors@that are circulating among the students.
She mentioned that if they don't take action, those@poor girls will continue to be misunderstood.

group_1.textLeft: You should definitely reject a topic as@troublesome as this!

group_1.textRight: Isn’t it fine? It's like fate or something.
Let’s commit to the Magical Girls topic until the end!

group_1.textLeft: [chara:800100:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]Whaaaaaaat?!
You've got it!
